Title: The Groundskeeper and the Ghost
Credits: Created by Jacqueline Gracey, inspired by Adam Smith (amsmith@ucsc.edu).

The estate.Body:
You are a groundskeeper tasked with revitalizing the grounds of this abandoned estate.
In the last hour since your arrival, it has become apparent you are not the only one there.
A nonhostile spirit of a past inhabitant remains; unable to move on to the after life, they beseech you for help.
Your job is to find the reason they can't move on.

The Courtyard.Body: The heart of the estate lays a serene circular courtyard. Radiating like spokes on a wheel, a network of cobblestone paths branch outwards, inviting exploration.

The Rose Garden.Body: Due to years of neglect, what lay are the skeletons of a once flourishing garden. Weeds now spring up in the spaces that allow for it. It doesn't look like anything else is here.

Look around.Body: Upon closer inspections, it looks like something was left sitting behind a rose bush.

The Statue Garden.Body: Reminisent of old France, beautiful stone statues spread in a methodical pattern. One statue in particular is covered with old plants, unable to see what is being made out.

The Graveyard.Body: You arrive at a small graveyard, most likely personal to those of the estate. You feel an energy drawing you towards one of the headstones

The Old Well.Body: A stone water well sits untouched for years. It looks like it has an indent for some type of tool to go.

Pull Up Well.Body: You use the crank to turn the mechanism attached to the well. With a creaking sound, the bucket emerges from the depths of the well, dripping with water.

Brush Leaves.Body: The leaves fall in a cluster all at once revealing the stone face of a young man and a small dog to the right of him. The plack reads: Timothy Johnson and Clover

Collect Item.Body: Looks like some sort of crank. [Item collected]

Read.Body: Through the mossy and chipped headstone you read: Timothy Johnson. The epitaph note writes 'May you and your best bud rest in heaven.'
